q: Leaders spend 5% of their time on the problem & 95% of their time on the solution. Get over it & crush it!
h:
“Leaders spend 5% of their time on the problem & 95% of their time on the solution. Get over it & crush it!” —
Tony Robbins

q: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
h:
“Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: The cost of leadership is self-interest.
h:
“The cost of leadership is self-interest.” —
Simon Sinek

q: Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.
h:
“Don't let your learning lead to knowledge. Let your learning lead to action.” —
Jim Rohn

q: To lead an orchestra, you must turn your back on the crowd.
h:
“To lead an orchestra, you must turn your back on the crowd.” —
Aristotle

q: Trust is the foundation of great leadership.
h:
“Trust is the foundation of great leadership.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.
h:
“Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.” —
Peter Drucker

q: All leaders are readers.
h:
“All leaders are readers.” —
Jim Rohn

q: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or to get all the credit for doing it.
h:
“No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or to get all the credit for doing it.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
h:
“Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.” —
Peter Drucker

q: A good master leads you to the true master within. Only that master, who is your own higher self, can adequately answer all questions.
h:
“A good master leads you to the true master within. Only that master, who is your own higher self, can adequately answer all questions.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Reality is the leading cause of stress among those in touch with it.
h:
“Reality is the leading cause of stress among those in touch with it.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers.
h:
“Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
h:
“Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.” —
Helen Keller

q: To lead the people, walk behind them.
h:
“To lead the people, walk behind them.” —
Lao Tzu

q: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
h:
“He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.” —
Aristotle

q: Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.
h:
“Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
h:
“Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Leadership starts at the top.
h:
“Leadership starts at the top.” —
Morgan Wootten

q: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
h:
“A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.
h:
“Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.” —
Colin Powell

q: No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.
h:
“No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Wise people, even though all laws were abolished, would still lead the same life.
h:
“Wise people, even though all laws were abolished, would still lead the same life.” —
Aristophanes

q: Many roads lead to the path, but basically there are only two: reason and practice.
h:
“Many roads lead to the path, but basically there are only two: reason and practice. ” —
Bodhidharma

q: A leader leads by example, not by force.
h:
“A leader leads by example, not by force.” —
Sun Tzu

q: You want to live but do you know how to live? You are scared of dying and tell me, is the kind of life you lead really any different from being dead?
h:
“You want to live but do you know how to live? You are scared of dying and tell me, is the kind of life you lead really any different from being dead?” —
Seneca

q: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
h:
“Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack. ” —
Seneca

q: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
h:
“Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Freedom from desire leads to inner peace.
h:
“Freedom from desire leads to inner peace.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Never argue with ignorance. It only leads to frustration.
h:
“Never argue with ignorance. It only leads to frustration.” —
Unknown

q: Leaders think and talk about solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.
h:
“Leaders think and talk about solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Leadership is solving problems
h:
“Leadership is solving problems” —
Colin Powell

q: Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.
h:
“Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.
h:
“Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.” —
Unknown

q: Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.
h:
“Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Becoming a great leader doesn't mean being perfect. it means living with your imperfections.
h:
“Becoming a great leader doesn't mean being perfect. it means living with your imperfections.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
h:
“A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.” —
Unknown
